heroIntro:
Welcome to your family's new home in Hacienda Del Álamo Golf, Fuente Álamo. This exceptional 3-bedroom villa offers the space to grow your family while maintaining the affordability that makes Costa Blanca attractive to discerning buyers. At €499,900, you're investing in premium specification construction at 40% less than comparable properties on Spanish island markets—a genuine value proposition in today's property landscape.

This 155m² villa sits on a generous 550m² plot, providing outdoor space for children to play safely while you enjoy the Mediterranean climate. The location in Fuente Álamo combines the tranquility of a residential community with proximity to excellent schools, modern healthcare facilities, and vibrant family amenities. International schools with British curriculum options are readily accessible, and the established expat community means English-speaking support at every turn.

Whether you're relocating your family from the UK, Northern Europe, or seeking a Mediterranean base with strong investment fundamentals, this property delivers on multiple fronts: space, value, community, and lifestyle. The area's +8% year-on-year property appreciation and typical rental yields of €800 per week provide financial security alongside family comfort.
areaSection: Fuente Álamo sits in the heart of Murcia's southern coast, positioned strategically between the bustling beaches of the Costa Blanca and the inland agricultural heartland. This positioning offers the best of both worlds—authentic Spanish living without sacrificing access to international amenities. The climate is Mediterranean with hot, dry summers and mild winters, making it habitable year-round. The town itself maintains a genuine Spanish character with growing infrastructure improvements reflecting regional development. Located approximately 50km from Alicante International Airport and 30km from the coast, Fuente Álamo offers accessibility without the congestion of coastal tourist zones. The surrounding Hacienda Del Álamo Golf community represents one of the region's most established residential developments, attracting families and retirees seeking stability and community.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in Fuente Álamo revolves around family-friendly rhythms and community connection. Your mornings might begin at one of the excellent local cafés, afternoon activities include access to championship golf courses or visits to nearby Blue Flag beaches within 20 minutes' drive. The established international community means your children will mix with families from across Europe, creating natural friendship networks. Healthcare is excellent—regional hospitals are within 30 minutes, with English-speaking doctors available at private clinics. Shopping is convenient with Mercadona, Lidl, and Consum supermarkets nearby, plus traditional Spanish markets offering fresh produce. Public transport exists via bus connections, though most families find a car provides optimal flexibility for exploring the broader region. Weekend activities range from beach days to exploring charming inland villages, with a strong sense of safety and community throughout the area.
investmentSection: From a financial perspective, this property offers compelling fundamentals. At €3,225/m², you're paying a 47% premium over Fuente Álamo's €2,200/m² average, justified by the premium specification and Hacienda Del Álamo location—yet remain 40% below comparable properties on Mallorca or Ibiza. The regional market shows consistent +8% year-on-year appreciation, suggesting solid long-term value growth. Rental potential is significant: similar properties achieve €800 per week, generating approximately €35,000 annually from 7-9 weeks of summer letting, providing passive income during periods of non-use. The established expat community and accessible location support steady holiday rental demand. Whether you're buying as a family home, investment property, or hybrid approach combining personal use with income generation, the financial case is robust.
conclusion:
This villa in Hacienda Del Álamo Golf represents the convergence of family lifestyle, financial value, and investment fundamentals. You're acquiring premium-specification living space at 40% below comparable island markets, within an established community offering schools, healthcare, and international friendship networks. The €499,900 investment delivers immediate family benefits—space, security, Mediterranean lifestyle—alongside appreciating asset value and rental income potential.

The 550m² plot offers the outdoor space children need, while proximity to beaches, golf courses, and cultural attractions provides weekend activities. faqs.question: Combien coûte ce bien immobilier ?
faqs.answer: €499,900. This price includes a premium-specification 3-bedroom villa on 550m² plot in the established Hacienda Del Álamo Golf community. Payment options typically include deposits as low as 10-20%, with flexible completion timelines. Financing through Spanish lenders is available to foreign buyers with proper documentation.

faqs.question: Les étrangers peuvent-ils acheter un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Non-EU citizens can freely purchase property in Spain without restrictions. EU citizens have identical rights to Spanish nationals. The process requires a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), completion of property documentation, and registration at the land registry. Most foreign buyers work with Spanish solicitors specializing in international sales to ensure smooth transactions.

faqs.question: Quels sont les frais d'achat d'un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect additional costs of approximately 10-12% including: transfer tax (6-10%), notary fees (0.5-1%), land registry fees (0.5%), and legal/solicitor fees (0.5-1%). Stamp duty varies by region. Once owned, annual property tax (IBI) is modest—typically €200-400 for properties in this price range—plus building insurance and community fees if applicable.

faqs.question: Puis-je obtenir un prêt hypothécaire en Espagne en tant qu'étranger ?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign buyers can obtain Spanish mortgages through major banks including BBVA, CaixaBank, and Sabadell. Typically, lenders offer 60-70% loan-to-value financing at competitive rates. Requirements include stable income documentation, proof of funds for deposit, and a Spanish tax number. Many foreign buyers find rates competitive with UK mortgages, often in the 3-4% range for 20-year terms.

faqs.question: Quel est le coût de la vie sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in Fuente Álamo is significantly lower than UK equivalents. Groceries, dining, and utilities average 20-30% less than UK prices. A family of four typically budgets €1,200-1,500 monthly for living expenses (excluding property costs). Healthcare, childcare, and education are particularly affordable. Restaurants offer three-course meals for €12-18. This affordability is a major draw for families relocating from Northern Europe.

faqs.question: La Costa Blanca est-elle un bon endroit pour acheter un bien immobilier ?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca represents excellent property value with consistent +8% year-on-year appreciation. The combination of established expat communities, accessible amenities, Mediterranean lifestyle, and affordable pricing makes it attractive for families, retirees, and investors. Fuente Álamo specifically offers quieter residential living compared to coastal areas, with all amenities within reach. The region's infrastructure improvements and tourism industry stability support long-term value.

faqs.question: À quelle distance se trouve la Costa Blanca de la France ?
faqs.answer: Alicante International Airport, 50 minutes from Fuente Álamo, offers direct flights to UK cities including London, Manchester, Birmingham, and Glasgow. Flight time averages 2.5-3 hours. Budget airlines provide frequent affordable options, making UK visits practical. Many property owners maintain regular travel connections with family and friends, finding the flight time reasonable for maintaining relationships.

faqs.question: Quel temps fait-il sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate with hot, dry summers (28-32°C) and mild winters (12-16°C). Annual sunshine exceeds 300 days. Rainfall is minimal and concentrated in spring/autumn. Winter is pleasant and manageable compared to Northern Europe—perfect for families seeking year-round outdoor activities. Swimming is comfortable May-October, pleasant November-April. The climate supports outdoor living and reduces heating costs significantly.

faqs.question: Is this villa suitable for families with young children?
faqs.answer: Yes, this property is ideal for families with young children. The 550m² plot provides safe, secure outdoor space for play and supervision. The 3-bedroom layout accommodates growing family needs, with space for home office/playroom if required. Proximity to international schools (15-25 minutes) supports education continuity. Healthcare with English-speaking doctors is accessible. The Hacienda Del Álamo community maintains secure, family-friendly environments with low crime and maintained grounds.

faqs.question: Quels revenus locatifs puis-je attendre de ce bien ?
faqs.answer: Similar properties in Hacienda Del Álamo achieve €800 per week during peak season (June-September), generating approximately €35,000 from 7-9 weeks of summer letting. Shoulder seasons offer €600/week (April-May, September-October). Winter months average €500/week.
